page.title: 10PRIVATE EDUCATION
page.content: The block probably contains the greatest number of private fee-paying schools in the city. Parents choose to send their sons and daughters to them, certainly for their more favourable staff-pupil ratio. Some parents feel their local maintained schools do not coach their pupils in a sufficiently demanding manner, especially in 'academic' subjects, the 'basics', and 'discipline'. Some private schools specialise int he arts, dance and drama, others in coaching pupils for entry to senior fee-paying schools. An entrance examination exists for these schools with quite clearly laid down syllabuses for children to work towards at 13 years old. For example, the recently established Leicester Grammar School near the city centre takes pupils at 11 and 13 years old. Some pupils go on to boarding schools.
